questions.text: Which of the following joint is formed between malleus and incus?
questions.solution:
The middle ear cavity contains three bones: Malleus, incus and stapes. Malleus and incus articulate with each other and incus and stapes articulate with each other.

The joint formed between malleus and incus is the saddle joint.

The joint formed between incus and stapes is the ball and socket joint.

questions.text: A 60 year old patient with a nasal lesion as shown in the image, choose the most appropriate diagnosis:
questions.solution:
Basal cell carcinoma is the most common type of skin cancer and often appears as a painless, raised area of skin. It can be shiny with small blood vessels running over it or present as a raised area with ulceration.

Here are some key features that suggest basal cell carcinoma in this case:

  • Location: The lesion is on the nose, a common site for basal cell carcinoma.
  • Appearance: The lesion appears to be a raised, pearly nodule with visible blood vessels.
  • Patient age: Basal cell carcinoma is more common in older individuals.

KEY TAKEAWAY-

Ulcerative lesion with rolled out margins is basal cell carcinoma.

Confirm diagnosis is made with the help of biopsy.

questions.text: A patient presents to the OPD with the complaints of episodic vertigo which is sudden in onset, sensorineural hearing loss (SNHL), and Tinnitus which lasts minutes to hours with accompanied nausea, vomiting and vagal symptoms. What is the diagnosis of the patient in accordance with the given audiogram?
questions.solution:
The given clinical history suggests its a case of Meniere's diseases.

 Symptoms: The patient presents with episodic vertigo, sensorineural hearing loss, tinnitus, nausea, vomiting, and vagal symptoms. These are all classic symptoms of Meniere's disease.

Audiogram: The audiogram likely shows a low-frequency sensorineural hearing loss, which is consistent with Meniere's disease.

KEY TAKEAWAY-

Episodic vertigo lasting for hours is Meniere's disease.

Vertigo lasting for seconds is Benign Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo.

Vertigo lasting for days is vestibular Neuronitis.

choices.text: Rinne's test - positive: Weber's test - lateralized to left ear
Rinne's test - positive: Weber's test - lateralized to right ear
Rinne's test - negative: Weber's test - lateralized to left ear
Rinne's test - negative: Weber's test - lateralized to right ear

questions.text:
A patient presents to the OPD with complaints of bilateral hearing loss with worsened right ear hearing loss. On examination, the doctor diagnoses otosclerosis and recommends stapedectomy as the final resort to the problem.
What would be findings of tuning fork tests based on which doctor recommends stapedectomy:
questions.solution:
Hearing loss is a presenting symptom in otosclerosis, usually starts in early twenties, often bilateral conductive type.

In conductive type of hearing loss, Rinne's test shows negative result for frequencies (BC>AC) and Weber's test is lateralized to affected (worse) ear.

Tuning fork test will show negative Rinne (BC>AC) first for 256 and then 512 Hz and after complete stapes fixation, for 1026 Hz. Weber will be lateralized to ear with greater conductive hearing loss. Absolute bone conduction may be normal.

questions.text: A patient presents to OPD with a complaint of hearing loss and can understand only shouted or amplified speech. What will be the degree of impairment according to WHO classification of ability to understand speech?

A patient presents to OPD with complaints of bleeding from nose and nasal obstruction, and difficulty in breathing. He gave history of bathing in local pool near his house. On examination, red polypoidal mass with whitish dots on surface is observed. Based on history, examination and given histopathological image, what will be diagnosis of patient:
questions.solution:
Rhinosporidiosis is a chronic granulomatous disease caused by rhinosporidium seeberi, most cases reported from India (southern states), Sri Lanka and Pakistan, Africa and south America.

Disease is also seen in cows, bulls, horses, mules and dogs in places where men and animals share the same infected ponds.

In the nose, disease presents as a leafy polypoidal mass pink to purple in color attached to the nasal septum or lateral wall, which is very vascular and bleeds on touch. It is studded with white dots representing sporangia. Patients may complain of nasal discharge, often blood tinged and nasal obstruction.

choices.text: I, II and V are correct
I, II and III are correct
II, IV and V are correct

questions.text:
Mark the correct statement/ statements regarding inner and outer hair cells:
I. Inner hair cells are in single row and transit auditory impulses
II. Outer hair cells are in 3-4 rows and modulate function of inner hair cells
III. Outer hair cells are more responsible for movement of tectorial membrane
IV. Inner hair cells are in single row and transmit auditory impulses
V. Outer and inner hair cells present in ratio of 3:1
questions.solution: The tectorial membrane is connected to stereocilia of outer hair cells and participate in mechano transduction.

questions.text: A50 year old diabetic male patient was admitted with a diagnosis of covid-19, Based on positive RT-PCR. Due to severe lung involvement he was treated with methylprednisolone. The patient was re-admitted to hospital, due to nasal obstruction and left side facial and orbital swelling, several days af5er discharge. In sinus endoscopic surgery, detriment was performed and the specimens were sent to pathology. A nasal biopsy showed a wide hyphae without septa as shown in the given slide. choose the most appropriate diagnosis.
questions.solution:
Mucormycosis is a rare but serious fungal infection that can occur in people with weakened immune systems. During the COVID-19 pandemic, there was a concerning increase in cases of mucormycosis, particularly in India. This condition is known as COVID-19-associated mucormycosis (CAM).

Risk Factors are

  • Uncontrolled Diabetes: High blood sugar levels create a favorable environment for the growth of the fungus.
  • Prolonged Use of Corticosteroids: These medications, often used to treat severe COVID-19, can suppress the immune system, making it easier for the fungus to infect the body.

questions.text: One virus has special affinity to mucosa stratified squamous epithelium. Which part is likely to get affected?
questions.solution: The Vocal cords are lined by stratified squamous epithelium. Rest of all the structures are lined by ciliated columnar epithelium.

questions.text: A child has swallowed a foreign body. What is the nature of foreign body as per X-Ray?
questions.solution:
Disc battery will appear as a double rim on xray.

It is an emergency condition. Urgent esophagoscopy is done because of the risk of rupture of the battery as it contains alkali which can cause esophageal perforation.
